page.title: 01A view of Milborne Port
page.content: { Milborne Port}is a village on the Somerset/Dorset border.It was called Milborne in the original Domesday Book.The village has seen many changes over the past few decades. We have surveyed Milborne Port and have found that the majority of dwellings are modern,stone-built,semi detached houses.There are also a lot of modern stone-built bungalows.The stone used is honey coloured Cotswold stone. The A30 runs through Milborne Port and is a very busy major road. Since the first Domesday Book the village hs grown to a population of nearly 2500 people. It is by no means a sleepy little village,there is always a lot going on.
